title: James Akoma features
description:
ID Name Description Provider 3rd Party Critical   
    Owner Integration     
1 VoIP(Internet Calls) STS Card        
  Ability for one calling Card Account to call one another via VoIP on cellphones  SIPPYSOFT customed Mobile Dialers provided by Reevesoft Connectivity. Account balances displayed on Dialer phones  
           
2 AirTime Transfers Airtime Credits TRANSFER-TO FrancySolutions    
  User is able to airtime Transfer credits to phones in >80 countries, both online and over the Phone on IVR   DIDforsale, Hostirian Hosting Debiting users' SippySoft calling card accounts with transfer costs  
           
3 Retailer-DashBoard Retailer/Reseller is able to sell Calling Cards via web Browser on Internet accessible cellphones or PC by making two entries; namely,Amount and Trusted Phone number SIPPYSOFT APIs  DB on ipage; Web pages, PHP scripting by P-guru Customer and sub Customers ability to create accounts and billing tariffs  
           
4 Conferencing Calling Cards design to allow Instant conference calls via IVR SIPPYSOFT customed  SynapseGlobal Carrier/vendors. Billing platform. G.711 conversion to G.729  
           
5 Phone E-Commerce  Ability to buy Calling cards over the phone. IVR using PayPal payment gateway. Card pins are e-mailed and or SMS to user- phone instantly SIPPYSOFT APIs  Twilio ; PayPal inp, PHP scripting by P-guru CC security

title: Custom web for MARCONI NETWORKS & TELECOM
description:
They have additional Access level for his custom web.

Installation: 

cd /home/ssp/custom_apps/
sudo cvs -d your_ldap_login@cvsro.sippysoft.com:/home/ncvs up marconi/marconi_web
cd /home/ssp/custom_apps/marconi/marconi_web/
sudo make install
psql -U sippy < schema.sql

For each environment on this server, that requires the custom web modification. Otherwise no custom modifications will be applied to those environments, they'll use default Sippy web
description_text:
They have additional Access level for his custom web.
 
 
Installation: 
 
 cd /home/ssp/custom_apps/
sudo cvs -d your_ldap_login@cvsro.sippysoft.com:/home/ncvs up marconi/marconi_web
cd /home/ssp/custom_apps/marconi/marconi_web/
sudo make install
psql -U sippy < schema.sql
 
 
For each environment on this server, that requires the custom web modification.
Otherwise no custom modifications will be applied to those environments, they'll use default Sippy web

title: Sales technologies
description:
DNCL - Do Not Call List, feature purposed to ban inbound calls, from specific "black" list .


We have an external lookup script set up for sales technologies on 72.80.56.53, (and probably soon also on 72.80.56.50).

I believe Andriy gave instructions on how to enable & disable DNCL using the following commands;

DISABLE:
sudo cp ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.noop ~ssp/scripts/external_translator
ps axww|grep external_translator|grep -v grep|awk '{print $1}'|sudo xargs kill -9

ENABLE: 
sudo cp ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak ~ssp/scripts/external_translator
ps axww|grep external_translator|grep -v grep|awk '{print $1}'|sudo xargs kill -9



There's one more important thing. In file ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak  there is a line: if cld[0] == '1' and (i_account not in (380, 376, 371, 375, 358, 356, 342, 83, 268, 357)):


The numbers listed there are account IDs. We exclude certain account IDs from DNCL, as they are exempt. I just added the 357 one now. It's likely that Sales Tech will wnat to add/remove certain IDs until we give them the ability to do so via the webinterface themselves. 

So, I believe the correct way to do this is by editing the file ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak  and then enabling/disabling the DNCL script.
description_text:
DNCL - Do Not Call List, feature purposed to ban inbound calls, from specific "black" list .  
   
 We have an external lookup script set up for sales technologies on 72.80.56.53, (and probably soon also on 72.80.56.50). 
   
 I believe Andriy gave instructions on how to enable & disable DNCL using the following commands; 
   
 DISABLE: 
 
 sudo cp ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.noop ~ssp/scripts/external_translator 
 ps axww|grep external_translator|grep -v grep|awk '{print $1}'|sudo xargs kill -9 
 
   
 ENABLE:  
 
 sudo cp ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak ~ssp/scripts/external_translator 
 ps axww|grep external_translator|grep -v grep|awk '{print $1}'|sudo xargs kill -9 
 
   
   
   
 There's one more
 important thing. In file ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak  there is
 a line: if cld[0] == '1' and (i_account not in (380, 376, 371, 375, 
358, 356, 342, 83, 268, 357)): 
   
   
 The numbers listed there are account 
IDs. We exclude certain account IDs from DNCL, as they are exempt. I 
just added the 357 one now. It's likely that Sales Tech will wnat to 
add/remove certain IDs until we give them the ability to do so via the 
webinterface themselves.  
   
 So, I believe the correct way to do this is by 
editing the file ~ssp/scripts/external_translator.bak  and then 
enabling/disabling the DNCL script.

title: BHAOO
description:
following applications/packages that are being used for critical jobs. Sippy team need to list down these applications and avoid to stop or uninstall these applications in any situation.

1. /usr/local/etc/rc.d/zcaprc
2. /usr/local/bin/zcap
3. libosip2-4.0.0
4. libpcap
5. sqlite3

Python packages:
1.psycopg2
2.libftp

Application directories:

1. /var/data
2. /root/zproc
3. /var/log/pcap

crontab entry:

*/5              *      *       *       *       /usr/bin/lockf -t 0 -ks /var/run/zpr.lock /root/zproc/zpr sm7

Please ensure that these application/libraries are not removed from any of the Bhaoo Sippy server.
description_text:
following

these applications in any situation.

 4. libpcap 
 5. sqlite3 
 
 
 
 Python packages: 
 1.psycopg2 
 2.libftp 
   
 
Application directories: 
   
 1. /var/data  2. /root/zproc 3. /var/log/pcap 
 
 
   
 
crontab entry: 
   
 */5              *      *       *       *       /usr/bin/lockf -t 0 -ks /var/run/zpr.lock /root/zproc/zpr sm7 
   
 Please ensure that these application/libraries are not removed from any of the Bhaoo Sippy server.

title: Custom Duration Announcement via IVR (ghost minutes also known as "Shadow Billing")
description:
Description:


Custom functionality for the IVR application which allows to announce more minutes than really possible.


Such scenario available only for calls via Calling Card application and could be managed independently only by non hosted customers.
For hosted customers such functionality could be configured only by sippy support.

To get script workable you have to create script on server and then specify path to it in the Calling Card IVR properties:



Here is the short scenario for you to make all required actions:


sudo -s
mkdir /home/ssp/private/scripts/; cd /home/ssp/private/scripts/
ee calling_card_duration.sh
chmod +x calling_card_duration.sh


Script Config:

#!/bin/sh
a=100
let b="$5 + $5*$a/100"

echo $b


Where a - percentage of increase.

So the system will announce the duration with 100% increase for all card numbers which use some exact IVR app in which you have specified "Custom Script To Change Announced Duration". For 50% you can use "a=50".


It is also a possibility to apply this method only for some tariffs, but in such a case custom development is required.
description_text:
Description:    Custom functionality for the IVR application which allows to announce more minutes than really possible. 
 Such scenario available only for calls via Calling Card application and could be managed independently only by non hosted customers.  For hosted customers such functionality could be configured only by sippy support.   To get script workable you have to create script on server and then specify path to it in the Calling Card IVR properties: 
   
 
  
  Here is the short scenario for you to make all required actions: 
 

  sudo -s mkdir /home/ssp/private/scripts/; cd /home/ssp/private/scripts/ ee calling_card_duration.sh chmod +x calling_card_duration.sh 
  Script Config: 

 #!/bin/sh a=100 let b="$5 + $5*$a/100"   echo $b 
   
 
 
 Where a - percentage of increase. 
 
 
 
 So the system will announce the duration with 100% increase for all card numbers which use some exact IVR app in which you have specified "Custom Script To Change Announced Duration". For 50% you can use "a=50". 
   
 It is also a possibility to apply this method only for some tariffs, but in such a case custom development is required.
